required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Alterations to Appetite Regulation Indices in Adults With Prediabetes Following Short-Term Aerobic vs. Resistance Exercise Training

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to learn about how type of exercise influences measures of appetite regulation.

detailed_description.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to understand the relationship between exercise modality and appetite regulation in a population with pre-diabetes. The study includes a screening visit to ensure eligibility of participants, baseline assessments, a resistance exercise intervention, and post intervention measurements. The variables of interest include, but are not limited to, hormonal responses to exercise training pertaining to appetite, food cravings, appetite ratings. activity levels, body composition, and ten repetition-max strength. The aim of this study is to better understand the mechanisms involved in the correlation or causation of any improvements in fitness and appetite regulation in a cohort with pre-diabetes.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants are randomly assigned to one of the two intervention groups.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline: Pre-Meal , 30 minutes, 60 minutes, 90 minutes, and 120 minutes post meal / Post-intervention(Week 4) :Pre-Meal, 30 minutes, 60 minutes, 90 minutes ,and 120 minutes post meal
primary_outcome.description: Hunger/Satiety before/after consumption of a meal

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Hormonal Response to Feeding
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline: Pre-Meal , 30 minutes, 60 minutes, 90 minutes, and 120 minutes post meal / Post-intervention(Week 4) :Pre-Meal, 30 minutes, 60 minutes, 90 minutes ,and 120 minutes post meal
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of Ghrelin levels analyzed in blood samples before/after feeding.

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluated via the Food Craving Inventory
Evaluated via the Weight Efficacy Lifestyle Questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Ad libitum Energy Intake - In lab
secondary_outcome.description: In lab ad libitum buffet lunch (via weigh and measure methodology)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Ad libitum Energy Intake - Free Living
secondary_outcome.description: 3 days of free-living ad libitum energy intake (via self-report)

arm_group.description: Resistance exercise will be training all major muscle groups 2x/week (2 days upper body, 2 days lower body) at 40-50% 1 repetition max (RM; estimated from 10 RM baseline testing) for 3 sets of 10-12 reps. This equals 4x/week for the 3 week intervention period.

intervention.description: Increasing strength and fitness and thereby influencing hormones and perceptions involved in appetite regulation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18-50 years of age
- BMI between 27-40 kg/mÂ²
- Hemoglobin A1c level between 5.7% and 6.4%
- Physical Activity (less than 150 min/week moderate-intensity Physical Activity, no more than 1 session/week of resistance exercise)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unstable Cardiovascular Disease
- Uncontrolled hypertension
- Severe hypertriglyceridemia
- History of or active liver disease
- Uncontrolled thyroid disease
- Active cancer diagnosis
- Smoking
- Engaged in exercise or diet program
- History of bariatric surgery
- GI malabsorptive disorders
- Significant diet intolerances
- History of major psychiatric disorder
- presence of alcohol or substance abuse;
- medications affecting weight,
- EI or EE in past 6 months;
- women currently pregnant, lactating, less than 6 months post-partum, or postmenopausal.
